Fields.DialogueText: Shigure? Why do you have a blindfold?
Oh! Kanchou, thank goodness you're here.
Have I come at a bad time?
Īe! No, well... in some ways, yes. But in other ways, I would rather have you here.
Let's start with the blindfold.
The Westerners have other names for the Funayūrei, don't they? Morganas, don't they call them?
Morganas.
It means... a mirage, or something to that effect. A trick on the eyes.
So you're going to blindfold yourself?
J-just to hone my other senses! They cannot fool what I do not use, right?

Fields.MenuText: They don't need to be seen to be deceitful.
You're making yourself look ridiculous.
How are your other senses?

Fields.DialogueText: Ah, I suppose not. I have heard that some like to impersonate voices.
You really think so? I could have gotten something a little closer to my wardrobe...
You'll have to take my word for it... but the spice in this tea has never tasted sharper.
Can you at least keep it off during battle?
Hai. That would be wisest. My imagination was starting to run a little wild.
Although...
Although?
It's terribly comfortable. I think everyone will be wearing them in the future.
I'm sure you do.
@BATTLE
I think blindfolds as fashion might take a while to catch on.
Maybe, Kanchou, but won't it be lovely?
Not being able to see really defeats the purpose of a fashion statement.
Just think of the benefits, though. It blocks out the world's distractions when they become too much to bear. Like a blanket, but for the eyes.
It makes you run into things.
Not I, Kanchou! I happen to have perfect spatial awareness within my hull.
Bully for you. Humans need a little more adjustment.
You would be surprised how well humans can adjust. Aren't the Funayūrei a perfect example?
*ALARM*
See? Even the chaos of the Funayūrei alerts waxes more orderly.
I hadn't noticed.
Perhaps I can lend you-
I'll pass.
@BATTLE
New fashion statement?
Kanchou, what are you talking about? We were just discussing my blindfold this morning.
No, not that. The new paint job.
Nani?
Oh, look down.
Nani? Dōshite!?

Fields.MenuText: I don't think pink is your color.
What is that even supposed to be a painting of?
It really complements your style... whatever it is.

Fields.DialogueText: Īe! N-not at all! That is the province of Nenohi-onee-san!
I don't know! Why don't I know!?
Kanchou, why is it there to begin with?
Calm down. Someone must have pranked you when you... weren't looking.
But... my other senses...
It takes a little while for that to make a difference.
Pain is weakness / That screaming leaves the body / To make room for more.
Hello there, Shigure! Feeling any better?
Kanchou, gomen nasai!
Shigure, it's all right. Falling to pieces is not required right now.
Kanchou, I committed a grievous sin against you!
When you went into your... state the other day?
I allowed the mischief of our sailors to send me into my rage state! Who knows what I could have done to you?
Beats me. You just sort of... gently tipped over a chair.
You don't understand!

Fields.MenuText: What don't I understand?
It was actually kind of endearing.
You're getting worked up over nothing.

Fields.DialogueText: The chair was only the beginning!
Arigatō... but please understand you could be in grave danger!
Nothing? You're lucky to be alive!
Please understand... oh, no!
*ALARM*
Kanchou, please be careful!
We can take the Morganas.
Trust me and allow me to atone!
You didn't even say what for...
@BATTLE
You're making this up.
I wish I weren't, Kanchou. Who was it that painted my guns?
Ensign Oxenstierna, I think.
And what happened to her?
She slipped on a puddle of seawater and sprained her wrist that night.
Why do you think I am so lucky in battle? When I get angry, it brings great misfortune to those who cross me!

Fields.MenuText: We'd need to test this to see if it were true.
Accidents happen, Shigure.
Is there any way to avoid it?

Fields.DialogueText: I-I can't! I won't!
They happen because of me! The other Kami are right to avoid me...
The solution is simply to let it run its course.
How long do these spells last?
In direct proportion to the degree of offense... so this one is long over.
Remind me to stay on your good side.
Would that I could guarantee that. I'm not always certain of what will set me off.
Do I get good luck for helping you clean your guns?
Heh... I had not thought of that. But I'd appreciate it.
*ALARM*
And we will have to wait for the guns to cool down...
@BATTLE
Looks like there was another raid last night in Kokura.
By the Funayūrei?
The opposite, almost. Police broke up a cult of Morgana worshippers. To think that anyone would pray to those monsters...
I suppose it's not unheard of. Have I told you of the gifts I've been given?
Is that what those charms outside your door were? I always assumed they were yours.
They are.
But you didn't make them.
Some of the sailors leave them. Omamori... food... sometimes even prayers.

Fields.MenuText: No pressure.
What kind of prayers?
Superstition again...

Fields.DialogueText: Quite a bit, actually.
Prayers for survival. For victory. Nothing miraculous, thankfully... though it's strange to get them.
It seems to have worked for me, so far.
Those who leave them just want to get through the day safely, mostly. Those wishes I can grant. Mostly.
You're still thinking about Oxenstierna, aren't you?
I've been so afraid to approach her. It's bad enough she has to live aboard me... would you want to if I hurt you?
Sure. You're the one with the infirmary. Besides, they say lightning never strikes twice.
I once had my flagpole struck nine times in an hour.
That's... unfortunate?
My hair was frizzy for a whole week after.
Maybe you can curse the sky not to rain.
Heh. That should make me uncomfortable... and yet it doesn't.
I'll take that as a compliment.
@BATTLE
Looking for something?
It has to have been stolen, Kanchou! Who on earth would have taken my book?

Fields.MenuText: Can Belles get ulcers? You're going to give yourself one.
Where do you remember having it last?
You probably just misplaced it again.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not aware that we can, though I imagine rust would almost be the same.
If I could answer that I wouldn't need to...
This is just like my glasses! One problem dies, two more rise to replace it...
If only you could put a chain on your book.
You'll be happy to know I haven't lost my glasses since getting the chain, at least...
Um... what are you doing?
Helping you look.
Kanchou, no!
What? You want to find it again, don't you?
You know how I get when I find something! What if you're caught in the aura?
Come off it. I've been lucky so far.
Really, it's all right! I can extrapolate the ending from what I've read so far, and-
Found it! Under your bed. What were you doing down there?
I'll just set this here.
The melancholy ghosts / Sail on oceans of their tears / Feeding them with ours.
... And put on some tea for when you wake up.
*ALARM*
Can't beat that timing, though.
@BATTLE
Here I was thinking I'd find you in your corridor again.
Hai. I prefer... something a little less traveled.
Hence this little corner of the engine room. Nearly hidden from everybody else.
You really must try it, Kanchou. It just feels cleaner in here, somehow. I may never leave...

Fields.MenuText: Why don't you tell me what this is really about?
For someone who doesn't like attention...
You know that's not an option.

Fields.DialogueText: I think you already know.
I'm aware of the contradiction, Kanchou. Maybe one day it will cease to be.
I can dream. I was, until a moment ago. I should really write it down...
I don't like the Funayūrei, Kanchou.
Nobody does.
Hai... and yet I find no joy in pain. Some Kami are indifferent, or even enthusiastic about hurting the Funayūrei, but I...
You can't afford to dwell on that.
... You're right. Forgive me. I err on the side of pacifism after an episode.
See if you can't do something about that. We're coming up on enemies now.
Er... Kanchou? Nothing's... happened to you lately, has it?
No. But if I come down with a cold, I'll know who to blame.
*sigh* At least we see eye to eye.
Shigure, it was just a joke...
@BATTLE
The way she screamed and twisted as my guns...
You're looking better already.
Ah! Kanchou, you're just in time. Come see what I've been writing!
Had enough of the engine room closet?
For somewhere you keep cleaning supplies, it can be quite dingy.
Ironic.
But then what would you use to clean it? The diseased organ cannot diagnose its own-
You were writing something.
Hai! Excuse the tangent. Ahem...
"Beautiful dead girl / Who breaks and bleeds and shatters / Laughing at her wounds / Phantom pain for this phantom / Gone courting death from her grave."
Now... what do you think?

Fields.MenuText: Who's it about?
It's morbid.
Haunting. I like it.

Fields.DialogueText: The Funayūrei I, um... blew up. The way she screamed and laughed... I couldn't help wondering if she enjoyed it.
That's the idea, Kanchou. I don't like to shy away from that in my writing.
Arigatō! I spent much time writing it.
The world is full of cruelty and pain. But if I can write about it, I can understand it... and then I can defeat it.
Winning battles doesn't quite do it for you?
Even victory can get repetitive after a while.
Oh, Kanchou! That was terribly vain of me, wasn't it?
Ha! You've earned it.
*ALARM*
Then... allow me to earn it once more.
@BATTLE
Shigure-sama! Sumimasen... do you have a moment to speak?
Ah... gomen... I'm afraid I don't, um...
Arigatō! I'd just like to ask a few questions about your tactics!
Well... that is to say, I cannot claim credit for... um...
Shigure, there you are. Tell me where the leak is.
What leak, Kanchou?
Ahem! Work with me, Shigure...
Hai! Let me show you... er, I think I feel it right... there, in my starboard side?
We best examine it in person. Sir, thank you for your time.
Captain! There's still a question I have about--
We can resume this conversation at a later time.
Right. Thanks...
Breathe.
Come to think of it, I think I could do without...
You know what I mean. You all right?
I'll be fine, Kanchou. The correspondent just caught me off guard.

Fields.MenuText: I'll see what I can do to remove him.
You can't avoid the press forever.
Is there anything you need?

Fields.DialogueText: Īe... That will not be necessary.
Wakarimasu... though, I would like the option now and again.
Really, Kanchou, all I need is some fresh air.
You're about to get it. Malice and her group have been sighted in these waters.
Have they? Perhaps I will take the initiative.
Not with a journalist, though.
Kanchou... I know you mean well. Please let me work.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, is he gone?
I ordered the correspondent back to his quarters. Imminent Morgana attack, you know.
Imminent... when was this?
Forever ago.
Arigatō gozaimasu. It really was getting stuffy in there.
You haven't been in there the whole time, have you?
I was going to leave, but it was dark, so I lit a couple of candles. The coziness just struck me... and three hundred pages later, here we are.

Fields.MenuText: You'll have to talk to him after we do catch up to the Morganas.
Are you feeling better now?
Is it a good book?

Fields.DialogueText: Perhaps when it's not so... loud.
Yoriyoi.
Another British one. It sacrifices vivacity for verisimilitude in places... yet, I'm intrigued.
Come out for a meal. The crew keeps asking about your momiji tempura. The memories of the last time you made them are still fresh in their minds.
Those did last a long time, didn't they?
Only because you made so many. We started rationing them toward the end.
How delightful! Maybe I will replenish our supply after all.
You're as good a cook as you are a warship. Maybe better!
I don't think a batch of momiji tempura can send me into a rage state, in any case.
Shigure, I didn't mean-
May we discuss this later? I sense danger.
@BATTLE
"Although the wind / blows terribly here / the moonlight also leaks / between the roof planks / of this ruined house."
One of yours?
Oh, no, Kanchou. It's a human poem, and one I can only dream of matching. Izumi Shikibu wrote it.

Fields.MenuText: Who?
Didn't she write The Tale of Genji?
You could have fooled me.

Fields.DialogueText: She was an imperial court poet. To think we're still reading her a thousand years hence!
That was Murasaki Shikibu... though they were contemporaries.
I don't deserve such flattery... but I do appreciate it.
It struck me while I was out here watching the skies. There is a lovely sort of truth to it.
Truth?
To be out here amidst the storms, the war... it's exhausting. I can't help but find beauty among it all, however. Even the Funayūrei cannot take the moon from us.
And the roof planks of the ruined house?
It depends on the reader, Kanchou. To Izumi it might have been a welcome respite from the garishness of the court.
To me... well, I suppose I'm a bit of a fixer-upper.
Aren't we all?
I take your meaning... but there is no one quite like me.
Exactly.
Oh, my. You're in a complimentary mood tonight.
Thought you could use a bit of luck. We're gaining on Morganas.
I'd quite forgotten. Am I wrong to blame the moon?
Only a little. I'll have to join you out here next time.
Hai! I mean... kashikomarimashita.
@BATTLE
Shigure, the correspondent's not going to wait forever.
But why does it have to be me, Kanchou? Any one of my sisters is just as capable.
None of them have come as close as you have to destroying one of the Morganas. That's why the newspapers want to talk to you.
I'm conflicted.
That's a surprise.
Really? I would think we'd have discussed this by now.
I-no. Never mind. Go on.
You remember when I was fasting?
It killed your cruising speed. I remember.
But I learned something about myself. About my limits. It was just... between us.

Fields.MenuText: You can't have it both ways.
You don't want to share that knowledge?
There are more important things to learn.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm starting to realize that.
I do, but... it won't be enough.
So much more. But it's scaring me.
I'm not like other Kami. My rage state, and my curse, and my luck... the more I learn, the more I want to know.
But the world will want to learn more too. They won't like what they find.
That's their problem.
That's the point. I hate causing problems for people.
What would you rather do?
Blow up Funayūrei and write poetry, ideally. Just... alone.
You're not as dangerous as you think you are. Well, you are, but in the right way.
Arigatō... I think?
Besides, when this war's over, maybe you can find a nice, private fjord to settle down in.
Hmm... I suppose that is something to look forward to.
@BATTLE
All right, ready when you are.
Ahem...
... Oh. Now?
If you like.
Sumimasen.
You've got this.
Well... welcome aboard... me, I suppose!
Arigatō. I'm here for Tokyo Shimbun, but I'm sure the rest of the world is listening to what you have to say.
Really? Um... Arigatō.
Yes. Now, you're famously quiet outside battle, but you have a reputation for ruthlessness. Where do you think that comes from?
I suppose that I--
*ALARM*
*BOOM*
Aah!

Fields.MenuText: We're cutting this short for now. Shigure, let's go!

Fields.DialogueText: Pity those weeping / Whose eyes see naught but water / When the sky rains fire.
Oh, hell.
@BATTLE
Captain?
Not right now. She's... not ready.
In time of despair / Drink deep such joy as you find / In the throats of foes.
What is she saying?
She's still cooling down from the battle. Go easy on her.
Miss Shigure?
The mosquito's buzz / Its anthem, its battle cry / And yet, its death wish.
Shall I just... come back later?
You finally got the hint...

Fields.MenuText: Get that correspondent somewhere safe!
Psst! Keep going with the interview. Try to ignore the Morgana attacks...

Fields.DialogueText: Very funny, Kanchou...
We will see him to safety, Kanchou.
Gomen nasai, Correspondent-san. I cannot stay.
Kanchou, has the correspondent finished his work?
Funny you should ask. I was just reading about you.
Give me that. Please.
Of course.
... It is as I feared.
It's just an exaggeration.
"Nexus of Misfortune Shigure..."
"Nexus of Misfortune Shigure ... Our Greatest Ally." Read the whole headline!
Kanchou... what did I do to him?
It's not relevant.
You know. You know, and you're not telling me!

Fields.MenuText: Shigure, it isn't your fault.
You're only going to worry. I'd rather you didn't.
He was seasick.

Fields.DialogueText: Just... just like Oxenstierna wasn't my fault? Kanchou, you've said it yourself... there is more to me than meets the eye!
It will be worse if I don't know!
Sumimasen, but... I do not believe you.
He was... nicked during the battle. Shrapnel.
Kuso!
It was his fault, Shigure. He was taking pictures and thought he was safe.
KUSO!
He was fine after-- Shigure! Come back!
*ALARM*
Damn it...
@BATTLE
Shigure, I-
Hmm? A note?
"Please forgive my absence. I am waiting for my curse to die down."
Oh, for pity's sake. Wait, there's another...
"I know my orders. Kindly slip questions and concerns under the door to my own quarters and I will have your answer posthaste."

Fields.MenuText: I'll come back later, then.
Shigure, I know you're in there.
Oh, I've got concerns all right...

Fields.DialogueText: Arigatō gozaimasu.
Hai, Kanchou. I will stay in here until I am needed.
I understand, but I will be all right in here. So shall you all be.
Shigure, this is ridiculous.
Wakarimasu... but I would rather be ridiculous than dangerous.
You can't depress the Morganas to death, you know.
I can try.
Oh, come on...
Well, just think about it, Kanchou. Their ways are alien to us... and ours to them. I ruined one with fury. Why can I not do the same with despair?
Where are you getting these ideas?
It's been nagging at me for days. If my anger can destroy my enemies... surely a sadness as deep as mine will do the same.
Now THAT is melodramatic, even for you.
Then it must be working.
*ALARM*
We'll see about that. Come on out of there...
@BATTLE
Shigure? Are you in here?
I thought for sure I'd find her in the mess.
Wait... what's this? Looks like her journal. It's open...
"Tending their orchard / The gods turn their attention / From those more worthy / Than a barren cherry tree / Among flowering laurels."
Kanchou? May I speak to you?
Whoa! Shigure... there you are.
Normally when I sense you in one place, you're eating, working, or sleeping. It's not a mealtime, yet here you are in the mess. Your defiance of routine made me curious.

Fields.MenuText: Hello, to you too.
Just lost in thought. I definitely wasn't reading any poetry...
Humans can be unpredictable.

Fields.DialogueText: It's been some time since we just talked. I thought it warranted an explanation.
You do that, too? Omoshiroi... that is where I get most of my inspiration.
I've noticed. That, or frustratingly predictable. There seems to be no middle ground.
Oh! I remember what I was going to ask you. Though I'm not sure I want to.
You didn't happen to lose anything, did you?
A journal of mine. Volume fifteen, I think it was.
I happen to have... wait, volume fifteen?
I start a new one when I lose the current one... or more commonly, when the pages no longer inspire me. I was up to nineteen at last count.
Don't bother, in any event. If I find it again it will just set me off.
You could call that inspiration.
I'd really rather not, if it is all the same to you. I prefer to think it forces diversity in my portfolio.
Don't you write exclusively haikus?
And tankas. I'll have to show you sometime.
*ALARM*
They say that those who don't learn from the past are doomed to repeat it.
I do not know who they are... but they must never have killed an enemy after finding their glasses...
@BATTLE
Um...
How is your tea?
Bitter.
Good. That means it is strong. It fosters a complaint in your head that begs for a resolution, and then... you spiral from there.
Your creative process is... interesting.
It just makes sense to me. Most of what you see here on my walls originated there in my teapot.
Poetry and weather patterns alike.
That's all writing is, really. You find a pattern and try to put it into words.
I wanted to talk to you about patterns...
Hai.
I did find your journal recently. Some of it concerned me.
Volume fifteen? No... no, if my memory is right, you did not figure in that one. Then again, I did not write in it long enough to-
Concerned me, Shigure. As in worried.
Nani?
The cherry tree thing, for example.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe if you explained this to me, I'd worry less.
There's so much self-hatred in this.
I thought we talked about your issues.

Fields.DialogueText: Mochiron. I'd be happy to.
I will not deny that, but there is more to it.
We did. I never said they were solved.
It's best understood in the context of my other writing, Kanchou.
Nobody else has asked to see my work.
Nobody else has read it.
That is what excites and terrifies me. But... do enjoy.
And understand... there is a point to it all.
If you say so.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
You took your time getting here.
Gomen nasai, Kanchou. I was at prayers for my fallen.
We haven't lost any crew.
I mean those who have suffered because of me.

Fields.MenuText: I've told you before that their suffering is not your fault.
I'm sure they appreciate it.
Pray a little more quickly?

Fields.DialogueText: I am almost at peace with that.
Whether they are or not, we can help them to be.
That would defeat the purpose of the exercise.
We still haven't conclusively proven that your rage state causes any misfortune.
Have we disproven it?
Do we need to? You're not a weapon.
Aren't I? The newspapers say... other things about me.
It may not happen here aboard me, Kanchou... but if enough people believe a lie, it starts to become true.
If anything, you're the luckiest of all the Belles.
Is that not just another lie? Another pattern? What if it's just... self-fulfilling?
So what?
That is a question I am afraid to answer.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Perhaps... perhaps I will talk to one of my sisters.
You don't already?
It's not like I haven't before, but... you know me, Kanchou. I can be a little hard to find.

Fields.MenuText: Reclusive, more like.
This is a step in the right direction.
What are you going to talk about?

Fields.DialogueText: I do love that word.
It is one I have not taken... which makes it one of the better options.
I... have not decided. Should I have?
I wonder if they've read the newspapers lately.
That might be a safe assumption. Though I guarantee they aren't as widely read as you fear.
That is a near certainty, Kanchou. But to know something is one thing... and to apply it, another matter entirely. And given what the world knows of me...
Most people haven't met you. You're not nearly as terrifying as you're made out to be.
Look me in the eye and say that.
Shigure, I'm serious.
Sumimasen - I meant no contradiction. I just find it easier to discern one's feelings that way.
You're not nearly as terrifying as you're made out to be.
Arigatō. I needed that.
The eyes speak a language the tongue cannot, Kanchou. That faraway look in mine during my state... I just need to learn how to speak that one.
You're talking in riddles.
I'm talking in poetry.
*ALARM*
Now I must talk in fire.
@BATTLE
"A lonely white rose / Opens her eyes, sheathes her thorns / And finds a garden."
You're looking chipper.
Ah!
How did you sneak up on me, Kanchou?
I was about to ask you. You're usually so self-aware.
Perhaps I am still... though in a different way.
You talked to your sisters?
I opted to speak to Hiryū-san about the article instead. She had... carefully chosen words.
What words?
Which ones? We must have spoken for hours over a private frequency...
"Humans just don't understand?" That seems an apt precision.

Fields.MenuText: There's still a lot we have to learn about the Belles.
Some good old-fashioned complaining, then.
You're not the easiest entities to understand.

Fields.DialogueText: And much we have to learn about ourselves.
Even Kami need to vent once in a while.
We are open to interpretation. Think of me as... a classic novel you've not yet finished?
Do you remember why I write, Kanchou?
To nail things down.
The answers are all around me... who I am, why I am who I am, how I am who I am... So easy to search, but so easy to be overwhelmed.
And setting things down on paper anchors.
Kanchou, that's terrible!
It's a pun.
And perfect in its audacity.
I'm in a writing mood, Kanchou... this Funayūrei may yet inspire me to begin a new volume.
@BATTLE
Hmm. How strange.
Looking over the formation's charts again?
Once these wounded me deeply. Now... less so.
The other Belles still avoid you.
I was so sure... and now I am not.
Or if they have been... the reason may not be as clear as I thought.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure talking to them helped.
So they haven't been avoiding you?
It's better not to obsess about these things.

Fields.DialogueText: Surprisingly... hai. It did.
I suppose it depends on your definition of "avoiding."
Try listening to a shark the next time one tells you it is better to live underwater.
Where there was smoke, Kanchou, there may have been fire. My sisters may have their superstitions, but they are not necessarily the root of our relationship.
That's good to learn.
Hai. As is Hiryu-chan's appreciation for Izumi Shikibu. We spoke on her work for hours.
What did she think of yours?
She was saddened... but it means we understand each other a little better, and that was the point of the exercise.
I thought you'd seemed happier lately.
That, too. There is always the specter of doubt.
Speaking of specters... I have an idea.
I'd be happy to hear it.
I am still working on the idea. For now, we will proceed as before.
@BATTLE
You're sure about this?
Mostly. But that is enough.

Fields.MenuText: The radio's yours.

Fields.DialogueText: Um... Konnichiwa, Funayūrei-san.
Are you the melancholy Kami?
Hai. Watashi wa Shigure desu.
An honor. The humans fear you like few of our number. My sisters envy you.
I thought you might say that.
How many of them will you destroy to strike us down? What is a victory worth to you?
I anticipated that as well. I have spilled ink and tears alike pondering your question.
We are but... the vanguard. The fires of hell we bring with us shall be--
... Quenched only in blood?
... Indeed.
You are creatures of despair, Funayūrei. You deal death across the seas and reap a harvest of sorrow.
I, too, know despair... that of loneliness. You may attempt to use that as a weapon... and you will find that I reject it.
She's moving to fire!
My left and right hands / Have met each other at last / Gripping a sword's hilt.
Shigure, your rage state... be careful!
Osoreru koto wa arimasen. My eyes are open.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Calling up Morganas on the radio may not be wise.
Calling up Morganas on the radio may not even be possible.

Fields.DialogueText: Arigatō.
Even if they refuse to reply, I am sure they will hear me.
It is a foolish wisdom that I trust now, Kanchou.
Kanchou, you are welcome to join me. I need someone to watch the stove.
You seem to have it under control.
I do. But inspiration has struck and I must write this down before it escapes me.

Fields.MenuText: I thought last night's fish seemed a little burned.
I can't eat a poem.
What are you writing?

Fields.DialogueText: The verse was worth the tragedy of the albacore.
Neither can I. I do not advise trying.
Something I have been meaning to finish for a while. I will not let the mood pass again.
I've been contacted by Tokyo Shimbun, you know.
How are they?
Champing at the bit. That last Morgana was spotted limping past the Chinese coast. Nearly unrecognizable.
She ought not to menace our people for a while. I am glad.
What was that you did to her?
When I was speaking to her?
I thought we'd... lost you again.
For a moment, I thought I had lost myself. Yet, the battle is clear in my memory like no others we have fought.
You can control it?
To an extent. We will see... but I am more intrigued than afraid, these days.
Maybe you've gotten used to it.
In a sense. I hate losing things... and losing control of the world around me. If I seem sad... it is because I dwell on things. I fear I may miss something if I do not.
What changed?
I came to a conclusion.
What was that?
That I am always sad.
I could have told you that.
Knowing is one thing. Applying is another.
@BATTLE
For once, Kanchou, I am looking forward to today's battle.
For once?
There is a newness to the order of combat, now that I am learning to control myself. That, and it will help me prepare a surprise for you.

Fields.MenuText: Not much of a surprise anymore.
You surprise me every day.
I'd be happy just living through the fight.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai, it will be. Just you wait.
Arigatō gozaimasu... in a good way, I hope.
That, too, I can grant you.
@BATTLE
All right, what was the surprise you wanted to show me?
Kanpai!
I didn't know you liked sake.
One of a few things I have always known.
And besides... it can be inspiring from time to time.
I've heard it said that good sake is served cold and bad sake is served hot.
A common misconception, Kanchou. Rather like tea, it depends on your tolerance for bitterness. Hot sake dilutes it, cold sake accentuates it.
This one in particular, I warmed over my guns after the fight.
It's as good a time as any for a glass.
I concur. I was going to spend a few hours out here writing... but I find myself lost for words.
Why is that?
I am coming to learn that there is no real reason. And that I will find them again.
At the bottom of a bottle of sake, for instance?
There is more to read there than just the label.
I hope there's a message about winning our next fight.
Is that you... humming?
Oh! Hai, Kanchou... Kimigayo, is what it is. I'm sure you know it.
The Imperial anthem.
I was just reading the English translation. It's... serviceable.
I didn't know there was one.
If you're a Westerner, it gets the point across. Though even a gaijin would think it a bit mawkish. "Whose venerable sides the moss doth line..." Such waste.
Seems wordy.
"Lush with moss" is closer to the original. Shorter. More evocative. It marries function with form in a way that the English cannot. Or does not.

Fields.MenuText: Less is more.
So why bother with the English?
You look like you're having fun with it.

Fields.DialogueText: Leave the reader to find out what that "more" is.
Part and parcel of knowing what to write is knowing what not to write!
It is amusing. I was reading the author's "Things Japanese"... the foreign perspective intrigues me.
Saint-Exupéry published a book not long ago. It says perfection is only achieved when nothing can be taken away.
It gives you something to focus on.
Strange... I am so concerned with other perspectives that sometimes, I lose mine.
That was the problem with my rage state, Kanchou. So many feared it... I feared one side of me so much... that I chose to dissociate from it entirely.
I'm glad you're learning to control it. Who knows what might have happened if you didn't?
Heh... well, there's still the curse to consider.
Superstition. Coincidence. Nothing more.
Arigatō, Kanchou. For trusting me to figure it out.
What you said to that Funayūrei... about always being sad...
Doubt is in my nature, Kanchou. It's just the way my mind works. Being able to recognize when and why... that means more to me than anything. Thank you for understanding.
I'd be a pretty poor captain otherwise. Maybe you're luckier than you think.
Perhaps I am!
